citations.narrative:
The record of animals on hand had not been updated recently, which was acknowledged by licensee. The licensee
thought they had 103 sugar gliders on site, but 131 were counted during inspection. The record of animals on hand listed
123 sugar gliders. Failure to maintain accurate and timely required records such as animals on hand can result in
inadequate husbandry of animals such as missed feedings, medical care and daily observations as well as impede APHIS
officials' ability to carry out their duties. Licensees must make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly
disclose information concerning animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased or otherwise in their
possession or which are transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise disposed of by the dealer. The records shall include
any offspring born of any animal while in their possession.
Correct by 26 January 2024.

There is excess buildup of excreta on bottom slide out trays of primary enclosures for the breeding colony of 121 sugar
gliders that are indoor housed. The cloth liners in the slide out trays are heavily soiled and caked with solid excreta. A
strong sour odor in the air is also present in the housing facility. The licensee stated it had been 3 weeks since the last
cleaning and there were plans to start cleaning today and carrying over the next few days. The sugar gliders appeared
healthy and clean during inspection. Failure to remove excreta from primary enclosures as often as necessary to minimize
disease hazards and reduce odors can result in the discomfort and contamination of animals contained therein. Licensees
must clean primary enclosures and remove excreta as often as necessary to prevent contamination of animals, minimize
disease hazards and reduce odors.
Correct by 23 January 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
